= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_VMWARE_VSPHERE.PUB.ACTION.TEST_DISK_CAPACITY
= General description = This action is used to check available space against specified datastore(s). The action returns true if an available data store is found with enough unused disk space, otherwise the action returns false. Kilo-byte size or Virtual machine will be used for the size requirements for the test. VM Name, location and folder Path can be used to query the VM. The Datacenter name, Cluster Name, Host name and Datastore name values can be used to query for available data stores.
= Failure Conditions = * VM Name and Kilo-Byte size both parameters are provided. * Neither VM Name nor Kilo-Byte size parameter is provided. * Kilo-Byte size value is non-integer or negative value. * VM doesn't exist or multiple VM(s) exist for the specified VM name.
= Inputs = * Server IP or DNS : Specify IP address or DNS name of the vSphere server to which you want to connect. E.g. www.myvcenter.com * Username : Username which will be used for this connection. E.g. domain\username * Password : Password to your username. * Port : Specify port which will be used for connection. E.g. 8080 * Protocol : Specify protocol you want to use for connection. E.g. https, http * Datacenter name : Specify a Datacenter name for query datastore. * Cluster name : Specify a Cluster name for query datastore. * Host name : Specify a Host name for query datastore. * Datastore name : Specify a Datastore name for query datastore. * Virtual Machine name : Specify a VM name. Used space by VM will be used to test the available capacity. * Location : Specify name of vSphere container objects like ResourcePool, VApp, VMHost, Folder, Cluster, Datacenter where VM(s) are located. E.g. Testdatacenter. * Folder path : Specify full folder path in which VM is located. E.g. rootfolder/subfolder * Kilo-byte Size : Specify a size in kilobyte to see if it is available on the datastore(s). Value should numeric and greater than 0. * Overwrite Agent : Overwrites the default agent * Overwrite Login : Overwrites the default login
= Behaviour = (none)
=Return Value= Action publishes following AE variable UC4RB_VSP_AVAIL_DISK_STATUS: This variable will hold the TRUE/FALSE for the specified test.
